hook.text: Mount Everest grows about 4 millimeters taller every year. The collision of tectonic plates pushes it up.

buildup.text: At 29,032 feet, it's Earth's highest point. Above 26,000 feet is called the 'death zone.'

discovery.text: In the death zone, your body is literally dying. Cells can't get enough oxygen to survive.

twist.text: Over 300 climbers have died on Everest. Many bodies remain on the mountain, too dangerous to retrieve.

climax.text: Traffic jams now form near the summit. Climbers wait hours in the death zone for their turn.

punchline.text: The deadliest mountain now has a waiting line.

quiz.question: What is the 'death zone' on Mount Everest?
options: Altitude above 26,000 feet where cells can't get enough oxygen
